    News
  • New website live
    28 Oct 2013
    It is not really news, but we are proud of it anyway. In october 2013 Indigov has launched it's new website with a design of Jan Neyens (our home designer) and technical implementation by  Hedgecomm. 
  • Indigov supports Zuiddag
    25 Oct 2013
      Zuiddag. Work for Change.   Each third Thursday of October 10,000 committed youngsters aged between 15 and 25 will roll up their sleeves for one day for Zuiddag.   Thousands of youngsters will not go to school for that day, but will work at a participating company, organisation or private individual. Each employer pays minimum €40 per youngster who worked for them. The earnings will go to a youth project in the South. On the basis of exchanges, the students from Belgium and the Southern youngsters get to know each other living environment. Zuiddag, i.e. South Day, wants youngsters to adopt an attitude of involved and active citizens.   Indigov has set-up an evaluation survey for Zuiddag to enable them to... more
  • DAV chooses Indigov as research partner
    19 Oct 2013
    DAV, the federal service for the reduction  of Administrative Burden, has chosen Indigov as research partner for the coming 4 years. "This is a reward" says Jo Steyaert, founder & CEO of Indigov, 'for the hard work we did in the last 5 years in this field. Indigov has developed methods to measure administrative burden in different fields so the federal government can reduce the administrative impact of its processes. Previous projects focussed on tax on web, the health sector, administrative burden for citizens and  eInvoicing.
  • Text mining 2.0
    09 Oct 2013
    Indigov is setting up a research & development project on text mining together with team member Jan Vangrinsven. Aim is to build a real time online environment capable to analyze live text based research and eParticipation projects such as online qualy focus groups, but also online brainstorms or interactive idea generators. Current tools for text mining often do little more than counting words (such as word clouds) or  correlations in appearances.  We have set-up a research projects where we are using technologies that are able to detract real meaning from text (i.e. thus more than just single words) and to relate these concepts to other meaningful content (other concepts or action words such as adjectives of verbs). The... more
  • eParticipation toolkit
    09 Oct 2013
    Indigov is an expert in eParticipation and enables clients actively in their, often first, steps in eParticipation. Whether clients want to set-up an on- & offline consultation project, interactive brainstorms or interactive tests, Indigov has an appropriate solution for you.
